page.title: 19HULL GRAMMAR SCHOOL.
page.content: {Hull Grammar School}is Hull's oldest school and for several centuries it was its only permanently established school. The earliest indications of its existence occur in{1347}and the 15th century town records show that it was then sponsored and controlled by the corporation. In{1479}it was endowed in connection with a chantry in Holy Trinity Church by the Bishop of Worcester and it occupied a building near the churchyard. A new schoolhouse, which still exists, was built there in{1583.}In{1878}the school was moved to temporary premises in Baker Street and then to Leicester Street in{1892.}In{1945}control passed to the new L.E.A. and the school was rehoused in Bricknell Avenue in{1953.} Under the plans for reorganisation the school will become an 11-16 comprehensive.
